unnormalised: ## Tuned In: Why Music Streaming is the Raja of Entertainment Now
normalised: tuned in why music streaming is the raja of entertainment now

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Remember the days of painstakingly creating mixtapes from FM radio, hoping you’d catch your favourite Bollywood song before it faded out? Or shelling out Rs. 75 for a cassette, only to discover the B-side had only one listenable track? Thankfully, those days are long gone, thanks to the ever-evolving world of music streaming.
normalised: hey everyone remember the days of painstakingly creating mixtapes from F M radio, hoping you’d catch your favourite Bollywood song before it faded out? or shelling out rupee seventy five for a cassette, only to discover the B-side had only one listenable track? thankfully, those days are long gone, thanks to the ever-evolving world of music streaming.

unnormalised: Music streaming has completely revolutionised how we consume music in India, and globally. It's become the undisputed raja of entertainment, offering an unparalleled level of convenience and choice. Forget trips to Rhythm House (RIP!), now you can have literally millions of songs at your fingertips.
normalised: music streaming has completely revolutionised how we consume music in India, and globally. it's become the undisputed raja of entertainment, offering an unparalleled level of convenience and choice. forget trips to Rhythm House R I P, now you can have literally millions of songs at your fingertips.

unnormalised: Think about it: You're stuck in Bangalore traffic, inching forward at a snail's pace on Hosur Road. What do you do? You fire up your streaming app and blast some A.R. Rahman to soothe your frayed nerves. Feeling homesick while studying at IIT Delhi? A quick search for your favourite Kishore Kumar track instantly transports you back to your childhood.
normalised: think about it: you're stuck in Bangalore traffic, inching forward at a snail's pace on Hosur Road. what do you do? you fire up your streaming app and blast some A. R. Rahman to soothe your frayed nerves. feeling homesick while studying at I I T Delhi? a quick search for your favourite Kishore Kumar track instantly transports you back to your childhood.

unnormalised: The affordability is also a huge factor. For a nominal monthly fee – often less than the price of two cups of chai at your local tapri – you get access to a vast library of music. That includes everything from the latest international hits to classic Bhajans and everything in between. You can even discover new artists and genres based on your listening habits, expanding your musical horizons beyond your comfort zone.
normalised: the affordability is also a huge factor. for a nominal monthly fee often less than the price of two cups of chai at your local tapri you get access to a vast library of music. that includes everything from the latest international hits to classic Bhajans and everything in between. you can even discover new artists and genres based on your listening habits, expanding your musical horizons beyond your comfort zone.

unnormalised: Plus, with offline download options, you can save your data and listen to your favourite tracks even when you’re travelling through remote areas like Ladakh where network connectivity is sketchy.
normalised: plus, with offline download options, you can save your data and listen to your favourite tracks even when you’re travelling through remote areas like Ladakh where network connectivity is sketchy.

unnormalised: I recently re-watched "Dil Chahta Hai" and was instantly craving those iconic songs. Within seconds, I had the entire soundtrack playing through my headphones, a feat unimaginable just a few years ago.
normalised: i recently re-watched "Dil Chahta Hai" and was instantly craving those iconic songs. within seconds, i had the entire soundtrack playing through my headphones, a feat unimaginable just a few years ago.

unnormalised: Music streaming has truly democratized music access. It’s no longer about owning the music, it’s about experiencing it. What are your favourite streaming platforms and go-to artists? Let me know in the comments below! And don't forget to subscribe for more entertainment updates!
normalised: music streaming has truly democratized music access. it’s no longer about owning the music, it’s about experiencing it. what are your favourite streaming platforms and go-to artists? let me know in the comments below! and don't forget to subscribe for more entertainment updates!
